title: Praise and Victory
shortSummary: Psalm 149 is a jubilant call for God’s people to praise the Lord with new songs, dance, and musical instruments. It highlights the joy of salvation and the honor given to the saints as they carry out God's righteous judgment against the ungodly.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to David

keyCharacters.name: Israel
keyCharacters.description: God’s chosen people called to rejoice and praise the Lord for their salvation and king.

keyCharacters.name: Children of Zion
keyCharacters.description: A poetic reference to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, called to express joy and worship their King.

keyCharacters.name: Saints
keyCharacters.description: The faithful believers who are called to praise God joyfully and execute His righteous judgment.

definitions.definition: A small hand-held drum or tambourine used in ancient Israelite worship to accompany singing and dancing.
A double-edged sword symbolizing the power and authority of God’s word and judgment wielded by His people.
Those who are humble and submissive to God, who receive His salvation and blessing.
Nations or peoples who do not worship the true God and oppose His people.

outline.heading: Call to Praise the Lord
outline.description: The psalm opens with an exhortation to sing a new song and praise God joyfully with music and dance among the congregation of saints.

outline.heading: Rejoicing in Salvation
outline.description: God delights in His people and promises to beautify the humble with salvation, encouraging the saints to rejoice even in their private moments.

outline.heading: Saints as Agents of Divine Judgment
outline.description: The psalm concludes by describing the saints equipped with praise and a two-edged sword to execute God’s vengeance and judgment on the ungodly, demonstrating their honored role in God’s redemptive plan.

application: Regularly offer new and heartfelt praise to God through song, worship, and joyful expression.
Trust in God’s delight in the humble and seek to cultivate meekness to receive His salvation.
Remember that believers are called not only to worship but also to stand firm in spiritual authority against evil.
Rejoice in God’s promises and maintain a lifestyle of praise both publicly and privately.

keyVerses.text: Praise ye the LORD. Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone for the entire psalm, emphasizing fresh, communal worship of God.

keyVerses.text: For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals God’s delight in His humble people and His promise of salvation as their adornment.

keyVerses.text: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a twoedged sword in their hand;
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the dual role of believers in worship and spiritual warfare.

keyVerses.text: To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: It affirms the authority and honor given to the saints to carry out God’s righteous judgment.
